Recipes.RecipeCategoryDesc: Arabic cuisine refers to the traditional food and cooking style of the Arab world, which includes countries such as Egypt, Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Iraq, and others. It is known for its rich and flavorful dishes that are often made with a combination of spices, herbs, and fresh ingredients. Some popular Arabic dishes include hummus, falafel, shawarma, tabbouleh, and baklava. Arabic cuisine also includes a variety of meat and poultry dishes, such as kebabs, shish taouk, and lamb chops, as well as many vegetarian and vegan options.

RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientDesc: The meat I am using in this recipe is a mix of Lamb bone-in cuts which I let the butcher chop into smaller pieces. You can use Lamb shank, leg, or any part you like, as long you manage to have them chop into pieces.

Traditionally, locals use the dry goat's milk called Jameed. However, in this recipe, I am using just plain yogurt. Some versions of Mansaf, like my recipe, prefer to use plain yogurt or Greek yogurt.
When you are boiling the lamb, I add a few spices to make sure the broth is flavorful. These spices include cinnamon stick, allspice, cardamom, bay leaves, peppercorn, and cloves.

To enhance the flavor of this dish, I use garlic- that I sauteed in olive oil, and lemon juice which I later transfer all of them into my cooked yogurt sauce. Because Jameed has a natural sour taste, you will need lemon juice to add the sourness to the yogurt soup.
I am using long-grain rice which I mix with turmeric and olive oil.

To make a Maqluba spice, I use a ready-made Baharat spice, Allspice, Bay Leaves, and Turmeric that I purchased from a Middle Eastern grocery store. These baharat spices already contain all kinds of spices which is easier and more convenient for me. If you don't have Baharat spice, you can use Garam Masala which is an Indian mixed spice. They taste similar except it is mildly spicy.
I use these 3 important vegetables for my Makloubeh- Potatoes, Eggplants, and Cauliflowers. It is important to fry them first before putting them into the pot since it will give a nice brown texture.
I am using Chicken as my protein meat. I prefer drumstick and thigh part since they are tender and juicy.
I am using just the ordinary rice for my recipe. Do not use any short grain or sticky rice as this will ruin the texture of the maqluba.
You need cooking oil when frying the vegetables & chicken, and salt & black pepper for taste.

For making the rice filling for the stuffed cabbage, here is what you need: Uncooked long grain rice, Ground Beef, Red Onion Coriander Leaves (You can switch with parsley or mint leaves if you like), Cumin Powder.
I am using Cannonball Cabbage when simmering in the pot. You can use other types of green Cabbage if you like.
When boiling or simmering the cabbage roll, I am mixing with water, tomato paste, chicken cube, and allspice. This will make the broth flavorful.

So as not to make this dish boring, I like to add chicken and sliced potatoes & tomatoes in the pot when simmering the malfouf. Adding some protein and potatoes will make this meal complete. But this is just optional if you don't want to.
Lettuce.
Parsley.
Cucumber.
Tomatoes.

Recipes.RecipeCategoryDesc: Turkish cuisine is a fusion of Central Asian, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean influences. It is known for its rich and diverse flavors, with an emphasis on fresh ingredients and bold spices. Some popular Turkish dishes include kebabs, pide (a type of Turkish pizza), meze (a variety of small dishes served as appetizers), and baklava. Turkish cuisine also includes a variety of soups, stews, and rice dishes, as well as seafood and vegetarian options.

RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientDesc: I am using ground beef which is 90% lean and 10% fat. Honestly, it doesn't matter the ratio of fat and meat. As long you cook it longer to remove the excess juices, that will be fine.
I am using green bell pepper since it gives nice aroma, and eggplant.
Chopped tomatoes and tomato paste is used in this recipe.
o make the dish tasty, I use curry, cinnamon, & curry powder, garlic, onion, and basil leaves for topping.
as my 3 main ingredients for my salad.

RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientName: Green olives, black olives, and feta cheese
RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientDesc: I am using both green olives, black olives, and feta cheese since it gives a mild saltiness of my salad. That way, you don't need to add any salt since you get its natural saltiness from the salad.

RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientName: Virgin olive oil and lemon juice
RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientDesc: I am using extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice (optional) as my salad dressing. It will help enhance the flavor of my salad. Also, it is nutritious, healthy, and high in antioxidants.

Recipes.RecipeCategoryDesc: Seafood refers to any type of food that is obtained from the sea, including fish, shellfish, and crustaceans. Seafood is a popular food choice in many cultures around the world and is known for its nutritional benefits, including being a good source of protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Some popular types of seafood include salmon, shrimp, lobster, crab, and tuna. Seafood can be prepared in a variety of ways, including grilling, baking, frying, and steaming, and is often served with vegetables, rice, or pasta.

RecipeSubCategoryIngredients.RecipeSubCategoryIngredientDesc: I am using mixed of chicken drumstick and thigh.
The list of vegetables I use includes Potatoes, Carrots, and Bell Pepper.
Chopped tomatoes and tomato paste is used in this recipe.
I am using garlic, ginger, onion, and Filipino curry powder. The local curry is found in Filipino grocery stores.
I am using chicken as my source of protein since it is easier and faster to cook than lamb.
To make this stew dish nutritious and healthy, I added carrots, potatoes, and eggplant.
I am using brown Saj bread which is a type of Middle Eastern flatbread used on shawarmas.
These two ingredients are important to redden the stew and give a sweet and tangy flavor.
The onion and garlic help enhance the flavor of the tashreeb. Furthermore, I added chopped parsley leaves which I add to the stew and garnish as well.

Of all the ingredients, the spices are the most important one since this is what gives the flavor of your stew. Here is the list of spices I used for my tashreeb: Cumin Powder, Turmeric Powder, Curry Powder, Cloves, Cinnamon Stick, Black Lemon, Bay Leaves, Cardamom Pods, Salt, Black Pepper.
